text: Stamped IFC drawings, geotechnical report, and excavation plan reviewed
Underground utility locates (One Call) completed and visible on site
Traffic, erosion control, and safety barriers installed
Excavation performed to lines, grades, slopes, and benches per IFC drawings
Dewatering systems active if groundwater or rainfall present
Temporary shoring/slope protection installed if required by geotechnical engineer
Excavated material stockpiled, protected, or hauled off site as per reuse criteria
Trench bottom leveled and free of rock or debris
Sand or gravel bedding compacted under and around pipe (as specified)
Proper pipe zone material placed and compacted in lifts to minimum cover depth
Bedding and pipe zone material approved by consultant or geo report
Gradation or sieve analysis results submitted and confirmed compliant
Crushed gravel, sand, or granular type confirmed per ASTM or CSA specs (e.g., ¾” minus, Type I, Type II)
Select backfill placed in uniform lifts (max 150–300 mm) and moisture adjusted
Compaction equipment appropriate for trench size and lift depth
Field density tests performed at required intervals and meet minimum % Proctor
No frozen or organic material used in backfill
Import material approvals documented and traceable (trucking tickets, source ID)
Visual inspection for clay clumps, oversized rocks, or moisture content
Lift depths, moisture content, and compaction effort (pass counts) logged per lift
Compaction test reports submitted by third-party testing agency
Excavation log/as-built grades submitted if requested

id: • ASTM D1557, ASTM D6938, CSA A23.1, OH&S Excavation Guidelines
• Project Geotechnical Report, Alberta Transportation Guidelines (if applicable)
